'DÃ¦dalus' is a peer-reviewed academic journal founded in 1955 as a replacement
for the 'Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences', the volume
and numbering system of which it continues. In 1958 it began quarterly
publication as The Journal of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. The
journal is published by MIT Press on behalf of the American Academy of Arts and
Sciences. Each issue addresses a theme with essays on the arts, sciences, and
humanities. Special features include fiction, poetry, and a notes section.
Publication is by invitation only. The journal is indexed in [[Scopus]] and the
[[Social Sciences Citation Index]], among others.
